results.title: Jean Francois Millet
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Discusses the works of Jean Francois Millet, whose subjects were intensely Romantic, but whose treatment of the human figure was entirely Classical. His early work is almost a total negation of his later achievement.

results.title: Edith Head
results.creator_credit: Charlotte Kerr, Christian Blackwood, Blackwood Productions and Sokal-Kerr Productions
results.brief_description: An interview with multi-award winning costume designer Edith Head in which she discusses her career and presents some of the costumes she has designed for Hollywood legends including Mae West, Jean Harlow, Ginger Rogers, Dorothy Lamour, Paul Newman and Robert Redford. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: J.M. Turner. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark and John Brabourne Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Deals with Turner’s rediscovery of colour and its direct appeal to the senses, regardless of subject matter. He is considered by many to be the first “abstract” artist. One of the series of films written and narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark on the painters and sculptors who from 1750 to 100 engaged in the struggle between the classic and romantic ideals.

results.title: J.M. Turner. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark and John Brabourne Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Reviews the neglected works of Turner, concentrating on alpine scenes which show how he completely understood nature. One of the series of films written and narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark on the painters and sculptors who from 1750 to 1900 engaged in the struggle between the classic and romantic ideals.

results.title: Eat,Sleep and Cycle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976 Olympic Films”.
Riders from all over the world competed in this bicycle Marathon from Brisbane to Sydney. All the grit, determination and endurance of the riders is captured in this film. Rated: G

results.title: Running
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976 Olympic Films”.
Compiled as a visual aid to coaching and physical education, this film collects silent, slow-motion footage of the men’s track events at the 1976 Montreal Olympics.

group_works.title: [Various women's athletic events from the 1976 Olympic Games]

results.title: [Various women's athletic events from the 1976 Olympic Games]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976 Olympic Films”
Shows various women’s events from the 1976 Olympic Games. Includes jumping events - pole vaulting, high jump, long jump and throwing events - shot put, javelin. Also shown are baton relay, running hurdles, endurance events. Silent film.
results.title_for_label: [Various women’s athletic events from the 1976 Olympic Games]
